Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <BrokenBank> This still basically implies that reliance on people using KMD instead of their own currency has to happen for KMD to have any value (re @Matterbridge_kmdbot: [discord] <jl777c> https://medium.com/@jameslee777/tokenomics-are-for-tokens-not-for-coins-3f262d0aa4b3)

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: no

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <E>

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you ignore the spillover effect

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: we see it with PIRATE, where as it does well, people take profits and move it into KMD

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: as any ecosystem coin does well, odds are very good that people in the ecosystem are doing well

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and the coin at the center of the ecosystem is?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: KMD

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: via KMD you can go to PIRATE or VRSC or any other

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and there is also the 5% per year, which by itself makes it on a pretty short list of the top 50 coins

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: people forget that in open source, if you charge fees that are too high, then people will just fork it

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so you cant really charge more than the minimal fees, which means forcing artificial demand will just be a short term effect

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: we are after a long term permanent effect

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: of hundreds of high quality projects in the ecosystem

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: none of them obligated to pay a KMD tax, but where KMD is the path of least resistance

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: many ecosystem projects on their own decide to help promote KMD, and during the high growth phase what is the most important, if it isnt awareness

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: or we could charge a big huge KMD tax and get little to no adoption, but maybe it looks good on paper for those that dont understand the elasticity of demand based on higher prices

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: maybe you believe that BTC txfees being $100 is a good thing?

Content: what is the first reaction when you end up overpaying for something?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: to say, "hey this was great, lets do it again and again"?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: or, "let me figure out as quick as possible how not to pay such crazy fees"

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so i expect that projects that dont get much usage would just use ETH and other high tax platforms, but projects that will get a lot of usage will want to be independent. and why reinvent the wheel, the engine, the transmission, the brake system, ... if you can just use antara to jumpstart your project and be as independent as if you spent 5 years developing the same thing?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and imagine more than one successful project in the komodo ecosystem.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: there wont be a 1:1 spillover, but even if just a small percentage spills over, KMD benefits

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and there is always the 5% per year no matter what

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so maybe KMD is the more stable price in the ecosystem as compared to the new projects, especially if they are starting from a low marketcap
